comment: *Palhinhaea* Franco & Vasc. is conserved against *Lepidotis* P.Beauv. ex Mirb. [@greuter20142292, @applequist2016report].

Some treatments recognize multiple genera within Selaginellaceae [e.g., @zhou2023phylogeny; @zhouphylogeny; @zhao2026widespread]. No such proposal has been submitted to PPG, so we continue to recognize only *Selaginella*.
A proposal to raise the subgenera of *Equisetum* to genus level did not pass (<https://github.com/pteridogroup/ppg/issues/112>).

The monophyly of Gleicheniales is uncertain. They tend to be resolved as monophyletic in analyses of small-to-medium sized datasets [e.g., @schuettpelz2007fern; @rothfels2015evolutionary; @testo20164000species] but non-monophyletic in phylogenomic analyses [e.g., @qi2018wellresolved; @shen2018largescale; @du2022structural; @nitta2022open]. A vote to divide Gleicheniales among three orders did not pass (<https://github.com/pteridogroup/ppg/issues/44>).

*Sticherus* was conserved with a conserved type to avoid nomenclatural instability after its paraphyly was demonstrated [@vieiralima2023phylogenomic]. *Sticheroides* was subsequently described to achieve monophyly.
Includes *Mildella* Trevis. The ambiguous name *Allosorus*, which could be considered to apply here (or to *Cryptogramma*), has been rejected [@fraser-jenkins20172509; @turland2024xx].

*Cheilanthes* is more narrowly defined here than in most previous classifications. The bulk of the genus consists of a moderately supported clade within the hemionitids [@schuettpelz2025phylogenetically], but a few species treated in this genus are known to fall elsewhere in the cheilanthoid phylogeny [e.g., @kao2019lowcopy].

*Parahemionitis* is conserved with a conserved type to avoid nomenclatural instability in the genus name and in the epithet of the sole recognized species; *Mickelopteris* Fraser-Jenk. is thus a homotypic synonym [@lindsay20212836; @turland2024xx].
Monophyletic as circumscribed, due to the recognition of *Gastoniella* [@zhang2017phylogenya].

Includes *Leptolepia* Mett. ex Kuhn and *Oenotrichia* Copel. To avoid extensive nomenclatural instability---effectively, the species of *Microlepia* needing to be recognized in *Dennstaedtia*, and the bulk of *Dennstaedtia* needing recognition in *Patania* C.Presl [@triana-moreno2022phylogenetic]---*Dennstaedtia* was conserved on a conserved type [@triana-moreno20222892; @turland2024xx].
A proposal to split the segregate genus *Physematium* Kaulf. out of *Woodsia* did not pass (<https://github.com/pteridogroup/ppg/issues/73>)

scientific_name_authorship: Ching ex Li Bing Zhang & Liang Zhang

comment: Includes *Atalopteris* Maxon & C.Chr. *Ctenitis* is proposed for conservation against *Atalopteris* [@regalado20243047].

scientific_name_authorship: Li Bing Zhang, X.M.Zhou, Liang Zhang & N.T.Lu

comment: *Draconopteris* has been conserved with a new type to avoid a confusing set of nomenclatural changes to its sole species and to *Hypoderris nicotianifolia* (Baker) R.C.Moran, Labiak & J.Prado [@rothfels20182579; @turland2024xx].
Includes *Arthromeris* (T.Moore) J.Sm., *Gymnogrammitis* Griff., *Paraselliguea* Hovenkamp, and *Polypodiopteris* C.F.Reed.
